message.content:
cs.RO, cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.GR 

This paper deals with the problem of accurate metrical localization in mobile robotics, which is a core topic in the field of robotics (cs.RO). The approach presented in the paper uses geotagged panoramas from Google Street View as a source of global positioning, which involves computer vision techniques such as feature tracking and rigid body transformation (cs.CV). The method also involves non-linear least squares estimation, which is a common optimization technique in machine learning and statistics (cs.LG). The approach relies on visual data and odometry estimates to estimate the robot's position, which involves artificial intelligence techniques such as computer vision and machine learning (cs.AI). Finally, the paper also deals with personal localization in a real urban scenario, which involves the use of geographic information systems and spatial data analysis (cs.GR).
